title: Textile, mid-18th century
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery, wool foundation
Technique: tent, cross, and back stitches on plain weave
inscribed:
"SACRED TO THE MEMORY OF THOMAS SON OF ROBERT & PHOEBE WHARTON"
"BORN NOVEM r 26 1730"  "DYED JANUAR 25"
"Sweet Innocent now freed from all Alarms of mundane Grief Virtuture envious Harms From Pain & Sin thyb Soul shall best remain With Companions be thy Angelick Trayn in vain thy Parents call in vain deplores Thay haste to meet the on those wished for Shores Greater Than Poets feign where blissful Peace With Joys unnumbered never never Ceace What tho oue Ashes should not mixed be We hope our Souls will wine there way to the"
provenance: ex. coll. Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe
description: Verse between pillars with ships carrying the dead and the Hebrew sign for Life.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, mid-18th century.
mid-18th century. Medium: silk embroidery, wool foundation
Technique: tent, cross, and back stitches on plain weave. Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe. 1941-69-239.
